edu.first.robot

Class RobotModeSendableChooser

  • java.lang.Object
    • SendableChooser
      • edu.first.robot.RobotModeSendableChooser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RobotModeSelector

    public final class RobotModeSendableChooser
extends SendableChooser
implements RobotModeSelector
    A SendableChooser class meant to provide a safe environment to select a RobotMode from SmartDashboard. Is not capable of adding other modes once it is constructed.
    Since:
    May 08 13

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotModeSendableChooser

        public RobotModeSendableChooser(RobotMode[] modes)
        Constructs the selector with an array of options. The array must contain at least one mode. All the modes are displayed when this object is sent to the SmartDashboard. They are identified by their names.
        Parameters:
        modes - array of the options for robot modes

    • Method Detail

      • addDefault

        public void addDefault(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.Object object)
        Deprecated. can not add options
        This method can not be used. Robot modes should never be added except in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the option
        object - the option

      • addObject

        public void addObject(java.lang.String name,

        Deprecated. can not add options
        This method can not be used. Robot modes should never be added except in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the option
        object - the option

      • getSelected

        public java.lang.Object getSelected()
        Deprecated. use RobotModeSelector.getRobotMode() instead
        Returns the selected option, guaranteed to be an instance of RobotMode.
        Returns:
        selected mode
